meanings.definition: A device used to measure electrical power in watts.
meanings.sent1: The wattmeters displayed the amount of electricity used by the refrigerator.
meanings.sent2: The electrician used wattmeters to check the power consumption of the new air conditioner.
meanings.sent3: The wattmeters at the power plant had a competition to see who could measure the most watts.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like wattmeters, always accurately gauging the energy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The wattmeters hummed softly as they diligently recorded the electrical output.

meanings.definition: The plural form of wattmeter, referring to multiple devices used to measure electrical power.
meanings.sent1: The wattmeters in the lab were all calibrated to ensure accurate readings.
meanings.sent2: We needed three wattmeters to monitor the power usage of the entire building.
meanings.sent3: The wattmeters gathered for a group photo to celebrate their successful readings.
meanings.sent4: The field of wattmeters stretched as far as the eye could see, each one diligently at work.
meanings.sent5: The wattmeters chirped happily in unison as they synchronized their measurements.
